comments.parameter_info: THE BELOW KEY VALUE PAIRS TALKS ABOUT THE PARAMETERS THAT WE CAN CONFIGURE , THEIR USAGE AND THEIR POSSIBLE VALUES THAT CAN BE SET FOR PROCESSING DIFFERENT KIND OF FILES AND LAND THEM TO THE BRONZE ZONE
comments.source_timestamp_pattern: possible value is the format of tmestamp used in a file name . E.g. -> YYYYMMDD/YYYYMM/YYMMDD/DDMMYYY
comments.source_file_name: name of the file and also add the timestamp format in the file as given in the file name . E.g. ->  customers_YYYYMMDD.csv
comments.source_schema_name: Source schema name in case SOURCE_TYPE parameter value is table
comments.surce_table_name: Source table name in case SOURCE_TYPE parameter value is table
comments.custom_mapping_func_nm: Name of a custom function that you will create before loading the data into target
comments.target_timestamp_pattern: possible value is the format of tmestamp used in a file name . E.g. -> YYYYMMDD/YYYYMM/YYMMDD/DDMMYYY
comments.target_file_name: name of the file and also add the timestamp format in the file as given in the file name . E.g. ->  customers_YYYYMMDD.parquet
comments.target_schema_name: target schema name in case TARGET_TYPE parameter value is table
comments.target_table_name: target table name in case TARGET_TYPE parameter value is table
comments.source_file_options: different options that can be configured while reading a file . E.g. ->{'header': 'true','inferSchema': 'true', 'delimiter': ','}
comments.target_file_options: different options that can be configured while writing a file . E.g. -> { 'compression': 'snappy','mode': 'overwrite'}
